::: {.Exercise data-latex=""}

Calculez la concentration d'une solution de $\ce{NaOH}$ de pH = 9.3.
\vspace{\stretch{1}}

:::

::: {.Answer data-latex=""}

$$
\begin{split}
|\ce{H3O+}| = 10^{-9.3}
\end{split}
\qquad
\begin{split}
|\ce{OH-}| &= \frac{10^{-14}}{|\ce{H3O+}|} \\
  &= \frac{10^{-14}}{10^{-9.3}} = 10^{-4.7} = 2 \cdot 10^{-5}\ [M] \\
|\ce{NaOH}| &= |\ce{OH-}| = 2 \cdot 10^{-5}\ [M] \quad \text{(base forte)}
\end{split}
$$

:::
